panels.visual: Lueduo speaks from the shadows, his serpent-touched eyes catching firelight. His voice carries unexpected authority - he has known raiders and reavers, and Eskil is not one of them.
panels.dialogue: Lueduo: "The Norseman speaks truth. I have known men who glory in destruction. He is not one of them."

panels.visual: Giovanni spreads his hands in a peace-making gesture, injecting levity into the tense moment. The others begin to relax around the fire.
panels.dialogue: Giovanni: "We are all mad. Every one of us. But we are mad together, which is better than being mad alone."

panels.visual: Rahzalahn resumes playing, her music changed - still melancholy, still weighted with loss, but no longer quite so sharp. The wound is not healed, but it has been acknowledged.
panels.narration: When she resumed playing, some minutes later, her music had changed—still melancholy, but no longer quite so sharp.

panels.visual: Eskil stands at the edge of the firelight, watching the stars wheel overhead. The others sit closer together now - Bansi no longer quite so separate. It is, perhaps, a beginning.
panels.narration: The wound between them was not healed. Perhaps it never would be. But it had been acknowledged, and that was a beginning.
